H0.text: who invented the transtheoretical model of behavior change. James Prochaska

H1.text: who invented the transtheoretical model of behavior change. Carlo DiClemente

H2.text: who invented the transtheoretical model of behavior change. Albert Bandura

H3.text: who invented the transtheoretical model of behavior change. colleagues

A4.text: James O. Prochaska of the University of Rhode Island, and Carlo Di Clemente and colleagues developed the transtheoretical model beginning in 1977.

A5.text: Prochaska and colleagues refined the model on the basis of research that they published in peer-reviewed journals and books.

A6.text: He was the lead developer of the Transtheoretical Model of Behavior Change (TTM) beginning in 1983.
